newsitem.title: USA: Delta selects GE, Rolls-Royce engines.
newsitem.headline: Delta selects GE, Rolls-Royce engines.

text.p: Delta Air Lines said Thursday it selected engines from General Electric and Rolls-Royce to power its future Boeing fleet.
The engine order is a part of an aircraft acquisition plan worth about $15 billion that was announced mid-March and which makes Boeing Delta's exclusive jet supplier for the next 20 years.
Delta said the General Electric CF6-80C2B6/B7 engine will power its 10 Boeing 767-300 and 21 Boeing 767-400 aircraft that the airline ordered last month.
Delta said the aircraft are scheduled for delivery over the next four years.
Delta said the Rolls-Royce Trent 892 engine is to power the 10 Boeing 777-200 aircraft that the airline has options to purchase in the future.
